result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Karl Von Harris

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Karl Von Harris in court.  Attorney William Hotchkiss in court for Karl Von Harris.  Prosecuting attorney David T. Malone in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant has completed 15 hours of community service, letter of apology, and the essay. Defendant needs to complete restitution payments in order to receive the benefits of the agreement. Court orders $100.00 monthly payments towards restitution. Case adjourned to Branch 17.
Review hearing scheduled for January 17, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Received and Filed. Letter of Apology

Defendant Karl Von Harris in court with attorney Corey R. Flynn.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Karl Von Harris appeared by video means with Attorney.
Case in court for Deferred Prosecution Agreement hearing. State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law. 
Court is in receipt of  the Deferred Prosecution Agreement; Plea Questionnaire, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Elements of the Offense.
Court finds defendant knowingly and willingly WAIVED his right to have an in person hearing and agreed to proceed by Electronic Means.
 
The parties have agreed to a deferred judgment agreement. 
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and entered a plea of GUILTY
Defendant  examined as to the plea.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  
The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
The Court reviewed the Early Intervention Program Deferred Prosecution Agreement with the defendant.  
The court approved the Deferred Prosecution Agreement and ordered the proceedings suspended until Review Hearing.  
Parties informed this matter has been reassigned to Judge Davis Br. 21. Review Hearing scheduled.

Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to branch 17, Judge Carolina Stark, in Room 400 of the Courthouse.  Review hearing scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Addendum to Plea and Elements

Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights Form

Defendant Karl Von Harris in court with attorney Corey R. Flynn.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Due to court congestion, matter is rescheduled.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for July 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Karl Von Harris in court with attorney Corey R. Flynn.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Karl Von Harris appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Status Conference held.  Defense counsel requests DPA Hearing date.  Case adjourned, Br. 30.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

Defendant Karl Von Harris in court with attorney Corey R. Flynn.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Karl Von Harris appeared by video means with Attorney.  
Case in court for pretrial conference. Defense counsel has received discovery and an offer from the state. Case may resolve as a DPA. Defense requests status date to determine case posture. Case adjourned to Branch 30.  Status conference scheduled for May 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.

DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON (3/31/2022). IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Foot Locker at Bayshore Mall.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Karl Von Harris in court.  Alexandria S. Carlson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 30 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Karl Von Harris
Current: 722 West Glendale Avenue #3, Glendale, WI 53209   (Effective: 03-29-2022)
Prior: 722 West Glendale Avenue, Glendale, WI 53209
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 3/29/22 @ 1p
